Message.Title: The Most Bizarre Steve Ballmerism Ever is a Doozy
Message.Msg: Ballmer is proven to be a total #$%$...he knows NOTHING about real-world conputing... ------------------------------- Here is Mr. Ballmer's statement: How many of us have gone to a meeting with somebody who brought a tablet and then when it comes time to actually take notes, writes them down on pencil and paper. Or can't get at the spreadsheet...or try to use it in terminal emulator mode...or take [a long time] to set up and turn their tablet into something that approximates a PC." The answer is, actually, not many. The reason is that tablet customers are a lot smarter about how to use their devices than Mr. Ballmer would like his own customers to believe. If he can get them to buy into the idea that tablets are just too hard to use in meetings, perhaps the Surface, which runs Windows and MS Office, will sell better. This is a classic, zany Ballmerism: say something that makes you look incredibly stupid to the opposing camp, and say it in earnest, and maybe some of the people in your own camp, out of sheer contrariness, will have something to seize upon and believe. -------------------------------

Message.Title: Just had to buy a new laptop at short notice: windoze 8 is garbage
Message.Msg: My venerable Lenovo Thinkpad T420S died after being dropped on the way through airport security at the beginning of a trip to Ireland. It was working fine, but the case shattered, and the damage included jamming the CPU fan, and the repair cost was way more than it was worth. So, I bought a new one - a core i7 Asus with 8G RAM, 1Tb disk and NVidia GT650M graphics on a 1920x1080 ful HD screen, and great audio (Bang & Olufsen). It came with bloody awful windoze 8, so I now count as a purchaser for M$. I'll try for a refund of the windoze tax, but I already wiped the HDD and installed Linux (SuSE 12.3). UEFI secure boot is a pain in the butt, but once I switched it off, Linux installs and boots like lightning. The only oddity is having to have /boot/UEFI as a windoze FAT partition, but I didn't have time to fix all the issues (even if possible), as I needed to get back to work. I played with w8 for a while before nuking it....suspicions confirmed....it is APALLING. I was going to dial boot, just to see how it went, but a short time with w8 convinced me that it is a waste of disk space, so it's gone. Everything works great -even the open source NVidia Nouveau driver is pretty solid and capable nowadays - even got full compositing on KDE . Once again. no M$ in my life!

Message.Title: Economically, Could Obama Be America's Best President?
Message.Msg: Forbes - 5/16/2013 "Significantly, in 2000 America had a budget surplus. By 2009 surpluses were long gone and the country was racking up historic deficits as taxes were cut while simultaneously outlays for defense skyrocketed to cover costs of wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Additionally, banks were on the edge of failing due to unregulated real estate speculation and massive derivative losses." "Although we hear almost no one in the Obama administration taking credit for record index highs, they should. Because the President deserves attention for how well this economy has done during his leadership." "Today the Congressional Budget Office is reporting a $200B decrease in the deficit almost entirely due to increased revenue from a growing economy and higher taxes on the wealthiest Americans. The deficit is now only 4% of the GDP, down from over 10% at the end of Bush’s administration – and projections are for it to be only 2% by 2015 (before Obama leaves office.) "

Topic.Title: Economically, Could Obama Be America's Best President?

Message.Title: Most Undervalued Stock on NASDAQ
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) currently $7.44 has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $65.13mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $42.76mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.68X revenues of $63.23mm, 6X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 7.64X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter and it just raised its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a yield of 6.45%. CCUR is the leader of some of the world's hottest technologies! CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. The #2 VOD technology vendor Seachange (SEAC) closed yesterday at $11.83 and is about to break its 52-week high of $12.10. SEAC has an enterprise value of $273.2mm or 1.75X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.67X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 20.12X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.75X revenues would value CCUR at $15.20 per share. An enterprise value of 15.67X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $15.32 per share. An enterprise value of 20.12X free cash flow will value CCUR at $15.43 per share. CCUR also has the leading Big Data Analytics software being used by pay-TV operators. CCUR tracks the behavior of 35mm pay-TV subscribers and has processed 15 billion media transactions. Big Data Analytics is the hottest space on Wall Street. Tableau Software (DATA) recently had its IPO at $31 and hit a new 52-week high yesterday of $61.45 for a gain of 98%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 24X revenues vs. CCUR's enterprise value of 0.68X revenues!

Topic.Title: Psssst

Message.Msg: For the remainder of 2013 numerous catalysts are currently in store for SNGX. Investors can expect a decision regarding the company's BARDA funding application for Orbishield™ (likely prior to the summer's end). It appears that numerous advantages exist for Orbishield™ including being in pill form rather than injectable, not needing refrigeration (due to utilizing SNGX's Thermostability platform) and having prior shown efficacy and safety as an active ingredient in animal studies. Following the contract decision, in the later half of the year we can expect the start of Phase II trials for SNGX's Oral Mucositis, the start for Pediatric Crohn's Phase II/III trials and the start of Phase II cGVHD trials. Between SNGX's large pipeline of pharmaceuticals and biodefense candidates coupled with the overwhelming amount of orphan and fast track designations received, I see SNGX as a highly diversified biotech with a great chance of success in the future.

Message.Msg: By: moonpunk 04 Jul 2013, 05:46 PM CDT Msg. 377436 of 377442 (Reply to 377430 by govcsy) gov - they have to have a distraction or they will explode. Their safety valves are under such pressure they need to desperately redirect attention away from the trend showing VCSY building every day toward a larger purpose. They've been planning a diversion campaign for a long time and now they're putting it into action. Danny is not the story here. I am not the story here. Emily is the story. Four powerful patents that destroy the traditional software culture represented by the people backing tepe, al, stockwabbit, johnnny and mirror. These are their hacks - low dollar thugs willing to contract for years to attempt to undermine the public discussion concerning what VCSY has. Now is when they need the maximum effort to redirect reader attention away from the intellectual property and off into a controversy they can use to fill the board up with hundreds of inconsequential small minded rants - phony indignation for somebody "damaging VCSY" while they've practiced the art of damage on VCSY for ten years. Last night and today show just how scary the future is for them. They spent hours in hysteria. Today they woke up realizing they overplayed that angst and it showed as panic. Now look how re-aligned they are. Al is calm and reasonable. The rest are claiming they "won" some sort of ridiculous semantic battle. The truth is tomorrow looms ahead of them and if the trend continues they're facing a brand new bunch of readers poking around for VCSY information. Attempting to counter the thugs' efforts is pointless but necessary. It looks to the readers like a typical penny stock discussion about a company collapsed from the dotcom era. That's good. Readers won't take rosy scenarios and wonderful technology stories as true. They expect a basher ravaged forum here with chaotic screaming and raucous hysterics. We achieved our end by passing the real discussion over to
